column4: Hello I was wondering if anyone was free to answer some questions about crontab for me
dont ask to ask but whats your question?
i can't seem to get my cron jobs to run with the @reboot command or my shell scripts to run is what i mean
I am on ubuntu 10.10 64bit / I think they are running before it is booted correctly?
can you put the relavant cron entries and scripts in pastebin?
sure
http://paste.ubuntu.com/564824/
cool I will take a look
where are you putting the shell script?
in ~/shellscripts
I am logged in under ryan
you want them to run at startup yes?
correct
use rc.local then
okay, I tried that earlier didn't work for me either. Is there a reason why it doesn't work as a cron job?
Im not familiar with the @reboot command although I assume it would need a call to the init reboot script as opposed to shutdown -r which could be the problem
makes sense, also can shell scripts be ran with sudo commands if the file is owned by root? say "apt-get update -y"
yes you can put sudo in your scripts and it will prompt you for sudo auth
but if I don't want them to prompt me, I want it to already have access so I don't have to be at my machine, what should I do?
use keys
I'm a little lost, I'm a newbie=x what do you mean by use keys
!kerberos | Vitasoy
look up kerberos authentication and ssh keys tbh its alot to go into
sounds good thanks for your help
